value.snippet: Album leaf (muraqqa') of nasta'liq calligraphy with drawing of seated dervish, Iran, c. 1500-1550 AD, ink, watercolour, and gold on paper - Aga Khan Museum - Toronto, Canada - DSC06874.jpg3,329 × 4,606; 9.73 MB Album leaf with calligraphic composition by Abdülkadir Şükri (SSM 120-0523).png1,833 × 1,295; 4.4 MB

value.name: Album. | Library of Congress
value.snippet: This muraqqa' (album) of calligraphy in an accordion format was compiled in Ottoman Turkey in the 12th century AH (18th century AD). The medium is ink and pigments on paper mounted on thin pasteboard.

value.name: [Muraqqa'] : 'Umar al-Waṣfī. calligrapher : Free Download, Borrow ...
value.snippet: Calligraphy, title devised by cataloger, black ink. 4 lines per sheet, fully vocalized. Upper and lower lines in Thuluth, two middle lines in elegant Naskh Hand, separate sheets, calligraphy album. It is a calligraphy album prepared for the purpose of teaching calligraphy.

Recueil d'adages et de hadiths (album calligraphique) Lā yamassuhu illā al-muṭahharūn tanzīl min Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn. ‏قرآن الكريم
